name: Eight Myths About Technology Research
description: In this video, the speaker discusses eight myths about technology research in the crypto field. They challenge the perception that only basic science produces public goods and argue that technology research also contributes to public goods. They debunk the myth that public goods research is solely the responsibility of the government, highlighting tensions between government research and accountability to taxpayers. The speaker addresses the belief that startups are good for research, explaining how startups often prioritize commercialization over pre-commercial research. They argue that researchers should focus on paying it forward instead of expecting immediate rewards. The importance of research management and acknowledging that technology resides in people's heads is emphasized. The speaker also highlights the difficulty of measuring technology impact due to uncertainty. Lastly, they challenge the notion that planning is worthless and advocate for better planning processes. Overall, the video provides insights into misconceptions surrounding technology research in the crypto field and offers alternative perspectives on these topics.
